summary:
The Carolingian Empire was a powerful kingdom in Europe during the Middle Ages, ruled by the Carolingian dynasty. It was started in 800 when Charlemagne, a Frankish king, became emperor. This empire included parts of modern-day France, Germany, and Italy. After Charlemagne's death, his sons fought for control, leading to the empire's division.

The empire faced challenges, like wars with the Danes and Slavs. It also had a large population, estimated between 10 and 20 million. The Carolingian dynasty's rule ended in the 10th century, but their legacy influenced European history.
title: Carolingian Empire
